remarks.para: May be inoperative provided affected No. 3 window heat circuit is deactivated.

placard.para: Placard on Anti-Ice Rain Removal Panel (P5): "#3 WINDOW HT SYS INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: No. 3L and 2R window heat circuits share a common power supply and circuit breaker, as do No. 3R and 2L circuits. To ensure that No. 2 window heat is unaffected by associated No. 3 window heat circuit faults over the dispatch repair interval, one of the following two methods may be used to deactivate the No. 3 window heat circuit.

numlitem.para: Remove the control thermostat from the affected No. 3 window(s) (AMM 30-41-06/401). This method is recommended if the control thermostat has the separate electrical connector installed.

note.para: The No. 3 window control thermostat (Window 3L Control Thermostat S759 and/or Window 3R Control Thermostat S762) is installed below the overheat thermostat on the aft edge of the window.

numlitem.para: Open 6E28 WINDOW HEAT PWR 2L & 3R and 6E30 WINDOW HEAT PWR 2R & 3L circuit breakers on the P6 Main Power Distribution Panel.
Lift the retainer and move the thermostat away from the windowpane.
Move the thermostat to one side and carefully lower the spring.
Remove the thermostat from the electrical connector.
Cap and stow the electrical connector for the removed control thermostat.

warning.para: ELECTRICAL SHOCK MAY INJURE PERSONNEL OR DAMAGE EQUIPMENT IF CONTROL THERMOSTAT WIRING IS NOT PROPERLY SECURED.

numlitem.para: Close 6E28 WINDOW HEAT PWR 2L & 3R and 6E30 WINDOW HEAT PWR 2R & 3L circuit breakers on the P6 Main Power Distribution Panel.

Remove the overheat thermostat from the affected No. 3 window(s) (AMM 30-41-06/403). This method is recommended if the control thermostat does not have the separate electrical connector installed. Removal of the overheat thermostat will generate the CMC message WINDOW 3 ___ HEAT FAIL if not already displayed.

note.para: The No. 3 window overheat thermostat (Window 3L Overheat Thermostat S1026 and/or Window 3R Overheat Thermostat S1029) is installed above the control thermostat on the aft edge of the window.

numlitem.para: Open 6E28 WINDOW HEAT PWR 2L & 3R and 6E30 WINDOW HEAT PWR 2R & 3L circuit breakers on the P6 Main Power Distribution Panel.
Lift the retainer and move the thermostat from the rubber ring.
Disconnect the wiring from the thermostat.
Lower the spring against the windowpane.
Cap and stow the wiring for the removed overheat thermostat.

warning.para: ELECTRICAL SHOCK MAY INJURE PERSONNEL OR DAMAGE EQUIPMENT IF OVERHEAT THERMOSTAT WIRING IS NOT PROPERLY SECURED.

numlitem.para: Close 6E28 WINDOW HEAT PWR 2L & 3R and 6E30 WINDOW HEAT PWR 2R & 3L circuit breakers on the P6 Main Power Distribution Panel.
